newsitem.title: CAMBODIA: Cambodia asks World Bank to increase loans.
newsitem.headline: Cambodia asks World Bank to increase loans.

text.p: Cambodia wants the World Bank to increase its annual loan credits to the country to $85 million from the current $75 million, a finance ministry official said on Thursday.

The World Bank launched its first $225 million three-year loan programme to Cambodia in July 1993 and has said it wants to continue this programme with a focus on health, agriculture and some infrastructure development projects.
The official said the request for more loans was made by Finance Minister Keat Chhon during a four-day visit here by six executives of the bank.
"The World Bank delegation left today, the visit was very successful," the official said without giving details.
The delegation's visit followed an announcement earlier this year by the bank that it intends to open a resident mission in the Cambodian capital by the end of the year.
